description: Used to introduce an opposing or contrasting idea. More formal than 'par contre'.
usage: Typically used at the beginning of a sentence or clause. Preferred in formal and written French.

examples.french: J'aime le thé. En revanche, je n'aime pas le café.
examples.english: I like tea. On the other hand, I don't like coffee.

examples.french: Le projet est coûteux. En revanche, il sera très rentable.
examples.english: The project is expensive. However, it will be very profitable.

examples.french: Il fait froid aujourd'hui. En revanche, demain sera ensoleillé.
examples.english: It's cold today. On the other hand, tomorrow will be sunny.

notes: Preferred over 'par contre' in formal writing and professional contexts. Some purists consider 'par contre' incorrect, though it's widely used in speech.
